description.narrative: (i) Environmental benefit: Annual reduction of 267,000 tCO2/year during 2015 to 2018 (ii) SME access to finance: At least a total of 35 eligible loans will be disbursed by the end of 2014 from a baseline of zero loans as of December 2010 (iii) Demonstration effect: Encouraging the Chinese government at both central and local levels to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type; and (iv) Capacity building: Promoting the development of industry specific loan underwriting criteria and improved risk management practices.

IFC is in discussion with Shanghai Pudong Development Bank (SPDB) to enter into a risk sharing facility (RSF or the Project). This would be the first phase of CHUEE SME under which IFC intends to support energy efficiency (EE) and renewable energy (RE) projects with small and medium enterprises (SME) in China through IFC RSFs with local financial institutions. In this proposed project, IFC would take credit risk in a loan portfolio to be originated and funded by SPDB. The Project is expected to receive support from the Global Environment Facility.
